messages.msgSnippet: Dawn, Do it! I m sure you ve been jabbed and prodded plenty. You go girl! ;-) Barb E The larger the island of knowledge, the longer the shoreline of wonder.
messages.messageBody:
Dawn,
Do it! I'm sure you've been jabbed and prodded plenty. You go girl! ;-)

Barb E
"The larger the island of knowledge, the longer the
shoreline of wonder."

- Ralph W. Sockman, Minister

messages.subject: My Family
messages.msgSnippet: My brother and future sister in law who do not believe in homeschooling, (let alone Unschooling) went to Dalhousie University in Halifax, Nova Scotia.  They
messages.messageBody:
My brother and future sister in law who do not "believe" in
homeschooling, (let alone Unschooling) went to Dalhousie University in
Halifax, Nova Scotia. They have been so proud about how wonderful this
place is and that only the best get in that I was elated to find an
article about a boy who was unschooled and at 12 years old entered
Dalhousie to end up with a Ph.D only 8 years later and is now the
youngest professor at MIT. Ahh is warms my heart to read about this.
Dare I be brave and send them this article? Why bother, they would have
some comeback about this boy.



http://www.newscientist.com/opinion/opinterview.jsp?id=ns23781





Dawn

Tucson, AZ



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
